summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration conducts research aimed at reducing crashes, issues regulations that set standards for safety equipment, and more. Its regulations are the product of a rulemaking process, which includes developing a proposed rule and responding to public comments. Legislation in 2012 and 2015 required the agency to issue 19 reports for Congress and publish 22 rules. As of April 11, 2022...
title: Traffic Safety: Implementing Leading Practices Could Improve Management of Mandated Rulemakings and Reports
